Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Particle::Particle ( Vec2d  position,
Vec2d  velocity,
double  density,
double  pressure,
double  temperature,
spMaterial  material 
)

construct a real particle NOTE the particle mass and volume will be specified in initiation::VolumeMass(w)

  • increase the total particle number

  • give a new ID number

  • set viscosity

  • set particle position

  • set states

  • set conservative values (mass and volume determined lateron) and their intermediate values

  • give a new ID number

  • set viscosity

  • initialize mue_ab_max to zero

  • set particle position

  • set states

  • set conservative values (mass and volume determined lateron) and their intermediate values

Member Data Documentation

const int Particle::bd

boundary particle or not

  • 0: inside the boundary
  • 1: on the boundary

double Particle::drhodt

particle.h(line 69-74) viscosity of each particle!!!Question!!!

density change rate for real particles

int64_t Particle::ID

ID number.

  • a real particle has a unique positive ID
  • a wall particle has zero ID
  • an ghost particle (for periodic boundary condition) has a negtive ID of its corresponding real particle
    Todo:
    {at least this is not true for my simulation where all ghost particles have ID=0!!!!}

double Particle::mue_ab_max

for time step control: max value (over all interaction partners) of mue_ab (paramter for monaghan art. viscosity, cf. Monaghan 1992 SPH review
